page.title: 07BUCHLYVIE PUBS & RESTAURANT
page.content: There are two public houses in Buchlyvie, one at either end of the Main Street. The{RED LION HOTEL}was built in{1843.}Though the original public bar was just one small room, it now comprises two public rooms downstairs and a function room or dining room upstairs, as well as overnight accommodation. The hotel has a seven day license and provides bar lunches daily.{ { THE ROB ROY INN}has been a public house since{1865,}has two public rooms downstairs and family home above.It also operates a seven day license.{ { THE SPINNERS RESTAURANT,}originally a two storey building containing four separate flats, has been altered to make a restaurant seating fifty people. It has four letting bedrooms and a loft conversion for the family. The restaurant opens five days a week.
